remarks: The infimum (expressed as supremum with converse 'less-than') of a set of reals ` A ` is the negative of the supremum of the negatives of its elements.  The antecedent ensures that ` A ` is nonempty and has a lower bound.  (Contributed by NM, 14-Jun-2005.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
statement:
infmsup $p |- ( ( A C_ RR /\ A =/= (/) /\ E. x e. RR A. y e. A x <_ y ) -> sup ( A , RR , `' < ) = -u sup ( { z e. RR | -u z e. A } , RR , < ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
